data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You should always be facing forward. If you take 10 steps backward. You would not be able to take backward if you kept facing forward. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and return is the same. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can take 6 and 4 steps back and it still takes 4 steps. You can take 10 steps and the same thing will get you to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Just because you start with 7 steps doesn’ t mean you return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn around and take 5 steps. It is necessary for you to take 10 steps in order for the instructions to work. In the first two steps we are completing the sequence back to the starting. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around, you would turn back to your starting point. So, the answer is No.

Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

In turn about you take 8 steps back to the starting point. Final answer: yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is always facing forward. Take 1 step left and you’re back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take a total of 9 steps, you get back to the starting point. If you take 3 steps, you get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To take a step backward, you always face forward so you always start from the beginning. To take steps forward, you always face the same way as you start. So, the answer is no.

In the first situation we always face forward. We take 6 steps backward and 8 steps right. The second scenario is almost identical to the first one, except in this case we always take 2 steps left. So, the answer is No.

A man must take 6 steps left, so he takes 6 steps left. The man must take 3 steps left to return his position to the beginning. So, the answer is Yes.

After the first 3 steps you will be face forward. Once you have made your way back to your starting point, take 4 steps left and take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is yes.

The starting point is the same as the starting point. You always always face forward. So, the answer is Yes.

To turn around, you take 4 steps to go around right. To take 8 steps back to your starting point, you take 8 steps to go back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

To turn around, you take 9 steps. Again, take 10 steps. Returning to the starting point would mean taking 10 steps, take 3 steps and then 6 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around is to move around or return. Take 9 steps is to turn back and the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

When facing forward, one makes their first step facing the same direction. The other makes their second step facing the opposite direction. The first step in each sequence is backwards. So, the answer is yes.

To return to the starting point, you need 8 steps because 1 step is equal to 4 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward you cannot take any backward step. It is impossible to take any backward in an upright person. Taking any backward backward in an upright person is a way to go backward. Therefore, the answer is no.

If someone faces left they will take 5 steps left. Before taking 4 steps right, take 1 step backward. If someone faces right, take 2 steps backwards. If someone faces left, take 5 steps left. Before taking 4 steps right, take 1 step backward. Taking 8 steps left is the same as returning to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

In the first example, the instructions took 4 steps forward while the order was reversed. Since you always face forward, if you're facing forward and you take 7 steps backward, you'd take 7 steps backward and 6 steps backward, respectively. So, the answer is no.
